Articles.Content:
Just curious, where's the DL?

I think this is the link you're looking for.

https://github.com/Pingopete

Edit: Also Pete if you need somebody to test new things for windows lemme know
I can test windows builds too!
Hey, I don't know if anyone's said this recently Pingo, you do awesome work! Thank you for your time and the effort you've put into this.

Thanks man it means a lot! Also good to know you guys are up for testing, I don't have much to offer yet but I've just had a load of time open up to work on RVE!

Edited October 6, 2015 by pingopete

I'm taking a shot at finding answers from a few threads, and the questions are here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55145-1-0-4-Real-Solar-System-v10-2-July-30?p=2231724&viewfull=1#post2231724

Just to give all the people following my port of RVE to stock a heads up. I was having computer troubles for the past couple of days and couldn't work on it but it is back up and running and I'm going to be working on it today
Pete have you ever built EVE Overhaul on Linux? I just started the port process but I was hoping you have something to make it work to save time.

Pete have you ever built EVE Overhaul on Linux? I just started the port process but I was hoping you have something to make it work to save time.

Yeah there's a branch specifically for that on the github repo

Anyone who is following the RVE to stock port, read the spoiler

I've decided to go ahead a release a public test version of RVE-Stock (or SVE) for people to try out if they want. Please be aware that this is still a WIP just like RVE is and the CityLights are not done yet, I still have a whole continent to do. If you run into any bugs PLEASE FOR THE LOVE OF GOD DON'T POST IT IN THE RVE THREAD. I don't want to take up pingopete's thread for stuff that might not plague his work on RVE, use the issue tracker on my github page for anything SVE related. All of the work I've done is fully credited to pingopete as this is all his amazing work I just tweak things. I'll include a link to the release page, the issue tracker, and include some pretty pictures for your enjoyment down below. Enjoy

Releases

Issue Tracker

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Looks amazing!

My ram D:

Hi, I've downloaded EVE and RVE onto a KSP 1.0.4 save with the following mods:

KWRocketry, community fixes for KW, All the Near Future stuff, Raidernick's US Probes, Soviet rockets, Soyuz, soviet probes, Firespitter, KSCSwitcher, Procedural Fairings for everything, Procedural parts, Habitat pack and FASA. The problem is I get a glitched out Space Center view. Is this due to Firespitter or something because when I remove RVE/EVE, the scene is normal.

Hi, I've downloaded EVE and RVE onto a KSP 1.0.4 save with the following mods:

KWRocketry, community fixes for KW, All the Near Future stuff, Raidernick's US Probes, Soviet rockets, Soyuz, soviet probes, Firespitter, KSCSwitcher, Procedural Fairings for everything, Procedural parts, Habitat pack and FASA. The problem is I get a glitched out Space Center view. Is this due to Firespitter or something because when I remove RVE/EVE, the scene is normal.

Pictures would help
Nhawks17 do you have a DL/source code? I might like to fiddle with that some if it's okay with you

Nhawks17 do you have a DL/source code? I might like to fiddle with that some if it's okay with you

Of my port of RVE? The spoiler contains a link to the GitHub release page. If you are looking for PSDs I only have one for the CityLights textures right now. Once I finish with those I'm going to look into fixing some visual discrepancies that I've seen in the clouds. Just lemme know what you need and I'll be glad to pass it along.
Pushed a new release for RVE-Stock. Get it here!

Pushed a new release for RVE-Stock. Get it here!

Cool! I shall continue to fiddle with it

Pushed a new release for RVE-Stock. Get it here!

Wait you created the effects of RVE for stock game? Or what are those files?

Wait you created the effects of RVE for stock game? Or what are those files?

Yes, its a port of RVE to work with stock Kerbin instead of RSS Earth, this is what it currently looks like.

Hi,

I've installed Ubuntu recently only to enjoy KSP, RVE and a long list of mods without crashes However, for the life of me I can't get RVE to work though seemingly I follow the readme to the letter. I'm sure I am making a simple mistake, here's what I did:

1. I downloaded the EVE Overhaul branch and extracted the Game data\EnvironmentalVisualEnhancement folder from the file x86-Release.zip to the KSP\Game data folder

2. I downloaded the Linux branch of RVE and extracted the RVE folder to KSP\Game data,

3. I understand that Scatterer is optional, so without Scatterer I get this:

As you see, the terrain and cloud textures seemed to be working, the only thing that is messed up is the sky.

Now, if I use Scatterer (with the RVE configs), I get this:

As you can see the terrain textures are stock, so RVE does not seem to be working.

Anybody else had this issue. Did I go wrong somewhere in my install.

Thanks in advance for your help!

Hi,

I've installed Ubuntu recently only to enjoy KSP, RVE and a long list of mods without crashes However, for the life of me I can't get RVE to work though seemingly I follow the readme to the letter. I'm sure I am making a simple mistake, here's what I did:

1. I downloaded the EVE Overhaul branch and extracted the Game data\EnvironmentalVisualEnhancement folder from the file x86-Release.zip to the KSP\Game data folder

2. I downloaded the Linux branch of RVE and extracted the RVE folder to KSP\Game data,

3. I understand that Scatterer is optional, so without Scatterer I get this:

http://i.imgur.com/QptvYZ0.jpg

As you see, the terrain and cloud textures seemed to be working, the only thing that is messed up is the sky.

Now, if I use Scatterer (with the RVE configs), I get this:

http://i.imgur.com/9sDQ3R0.jpg

As you can see the terrain textures are stock, so RVE does not seem to be working.

Anybody else had this issue. Did I go wrong somewhere in my install.

Thanks in advance for your help!

Hey Kuba, actually in those images only one cloud layer is working and there are no RVE ground textures. I forgot to mention in the readme you may now also need the BoulderCo folder from that overhaul zip you grabbed as well. It contains some DDS stuff and some shaders now I believe (could be wrong). Either way extract that to your gamedata as well and then just remove the atmosphere, terrain, and citylights folder from it (all those textures are provided with RVE, having these texture configs present in the above folders will cause issues when running RVE)

Hey Kuba, actually in those images only one cloud layer is working and there are no RVE ground textures. I forgot to mention in the readme you may now also need the BoulderCo folder from that overhaul zip you grabbed as well. It contains some DDS stuff and some shaders now I believe (could be wrong). Either way extract that to your gamedata as well and then just remove the atmosphere, terrain, and citylights folder from it (all those textures are provided with RVE, having these texture configs present in the above folders will cause issues when running RVE)

Thanks a lot Pete, I extracted the BoulderCo folder, which after deleting the folders looks like this:

but nothing has really changed, I still get this:

Yeah you got it right there.. weird, uhh did you apply the RSS-scatterer config change? That needs to be left alone (not changed) as RVE changes the naming system back for Scatterer to work properly? Else something's not in the right place I guess. You are using the linux branch from the github repo right? > https://github.com/Pingopete/RVE-KSP-1.0.4/tree/Linux64

Yeah you got it right there.. weird, uhh did you apply the RSS-scatterer config change? That needs to be left alone (not changed) as RVE changes the naming system back for Scatterer to work properly? Else something's not in the right place I guess. You are using the linux branch from the github repo right? > https://github.com/Pingopete/RVE-KSP-1.0.4/tree/Linux64

Big thanks for getting back to me Pete. Yes, I am sure that I am using the linux branch, I have a fresh install of Ubuntu and it is the only version of RVE I have downloaded. And yes I I copied the scatter folder from the repo to /gamedata and merged it with the existing scatterer folder (tried both versions of scatterer - the current one and the one suggested in the repo readme).

And to make sure, this is what I did:

1. Downloaded scatterer

1. Copied the RVE and scatterer folders from the RVE linux repo to gamedata

2. Copied the EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements folder from the zip filed in the Overhaul branch of EVE to gamedata

3. Copied the BoulderCo folder from the zip in the Overhaul branch of EVE to gamedata and deleted Atmosphere, CityLights, Terrain folders

that's about it.

Funny thing I noticed is that whenever I change the launch site, I seem to be getting an additional layer of clouds:

Edited October 17, 2015 by kuba1410
Is there a DL for Mac?

Hey, I'm also getting some strange issues on Linux. The clouds are acting weird and only show up once I enter space:

The clouds do leave shadows though. The ground textures are also still stock.

I'm running linux version of RVE on a new install of Ubuntu. I installed scatterer via CKAN. I copied the RVE folder to gamedata from the linux branch, and copied the scatterer configs. Then, I copied the EVE and BoulderCo folders from the x86-release.zip, from the EVE overhaul branch, to gamedata. Finally I deleted the CityLights, Terrain, and Atmosphere folders from BoulderCo.

Does anybody know what's going on or how to fix it?

Edited October 17, 2015 by zfurman
